SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.data

Interface Converter<A extends @Nullable Object,B extends @Nullable Object>

Type Parameters:
A - the type of the source object
B - the type of the target object
public interface Converter<A extends @Nullable Object,B extends @Nullable Object>
An interface for converting between two types, A and B. This interface provides methods to define forward and backward conversion functions and to execute these conversions.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Function<A,B>
    a2b()
    Provides a function to convert an object of type A to an object of type B.
    Function<B,A>
    b2a()
    Provides a function for converting an object of type B to an object of type A.
    default B
    convert(A a)
    Converts an object of type A to type B using the conversion function defined in a2b().
    default A
    convertBack(B b)
    Converts the target object of type B back to a source object of type A using the provided conversion function.
    static <A extends @Nullable Object, B extends @Nullable Object>
    Converter<A,B>
    create(Function<A,B> a2b, Function<B,A> b2a)
    Creates a bidirectional converter between two types A and B.

    Creates a bidirectional converter between two nullable types A and B.
    static <T extends @Nullable Object>
    Converter<T,T>
    identity()
    Provides a converter that performs an identity transformation, where the input object is returned as-is without any modifications.
    default Converter<B,A>
    inverse()
    Returns the inverse of this converter, swapping the source and target types.
    static <T> Converter<String,T>
    stringConverter(Class<T> type)
    Creates a converter to transform objects of type T to their String representation and parse Strings back to objects of type T using either the method public static T valueOf(String) in the specified class (preferred) or the constructor public T(String) of the class.

    Creates a converter to transform objects of type T to their String representation and parse Strings back to objects of type T.

  • Method Details

    • identity

      static <T extends @Nullable Object> Converter<T,T> identity()
      Provides a converter that performs an identity transformation, where the input object is returned as-is without any modifications. This is useful for cases where no actual conversion is required.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object being transformed
      Returns:
      a Converter that performs an identity transformation for objects of type T

    • stringConverter

      static <T> Converter<String,T> stringConverter(Class<T> type) throws ConversionException
      Creates a converter to transform objects of type T to their String representation and parse Strings back to objects of type T using either the method public static T valueOf(String) in the specified class (preferred) or the constructor public T(String) of the class. If neither are found, a ConverterException is thrown.

      Enums are formatted using name() instead of toString().

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to convert to and from a String
      Parameters:
      type - the class type for which the converter is created, requiring a public static valueOf(String) method
      Returns:
      a Converter that handles the bidirectional conversion between objects of type T and Strings
      Throws:
      ConversionException - if the specified class does not declare the matching factory method or constructor

    • stringConverter

      static <T> Converter<String,T> stringConverter(Function<String,T> parse)
      Creates a converter to transform objects of type T to their String representation and parse Strings back to objects of type T.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to convert to and from a String
      Parameters:
      parse - a function that parses a String to create an object of type T
      Returns:
      a Converter that handles the bidirectional conversion between objects of type T and Strings

    • create

      static <A extends @Nullable Object, B extends @Nullable Object> Converter<A,B> create(Function<A,B> a2b, Function<B,A> b2a)
      Creates a bidirectional converter between two types A and B.
      Type Parameters:
      A - the source type
      B - the target type
      Parameters:
      a2b - a function that converts from type A to type B
      b2a - a function that converts from type B to type A
      Returns:
      a Converter that performs conversions between types A and B using the specified functions

    • createNullAware

      static <A extends @Nullable Object, B extends @Nullable Object> Converter<A,B> createNullAware(Function<A,B> a2b, Function<B,A> b2a)
      Creates a bidirectional converter between two nullable types A and B.

      (A) null will be converted to (B) null and vice versa.

      Type Parameters:
      A - the source type
      B - the target type
      Parameters:
      a2b - a function that converts from type A to type B
      b2a - a function that converts from type B to type A
      Returns:
      a null-aware Converter that performs conversions between types A and B using the specified functions

    • convert

      default B convert(A a)
      Converts an object of type A to type B using the conversion function defined in a2b().
      Parameters:
      a - the object of type A to be converted
      Returns:
      the converted object of type B
      Throws:
      ConversionException - if the conversion fails

    • a2b

      Function<A,B> a2b()
      Provides a function to convert an object of type A to an object of type B.
      Returns:
      a function that takes an instance of type A and returns an instance of type B

    • convertBack

      default A convertBack(B b)
      Converts the target object of type B back to a source object of type A using the provided conversion function.
      Parameters:
      b - the object of type B to be converted back to type A
      Returns:
      the converted object of type A
      Throws:
      ConversionException - if the conversion fails

    • b2a

      Function<B,A> b2a()
      Provides a function for converting an object of type B to an object of type A.
      Returns:
      a function that converts an object of type B to type A

    • inverse

      default Converter<B,A> inverse()
      Returns the inverse of this converter, swapping the source and target types.
      Returns:
      a converter that converts in the opposite direction, from target type to source type.
